meanings.definition: To cover or stain with blood.
meanings.sent1: The hunter was beblooding his hands after a successful hunt.
meanings.sent2: The butcher accidentally beblooding his apron while preparing the meat.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy vampire kept beblooding the white carpet during his midnight snack.
meanings.sent4: The battlefield was beblooding with the sacrifices of brave soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The crime scene was beblooding with evidence of the violent act.

meanings.definition: To involve in bloodshed or violence.
meanings.sent1: The gang leader was beblooding the young recruits into a life of crime.
meanings.sent2: The warlord was known for beblooding his enemies without mercy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children were beblooding their innocent games with fake battles.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt politician was beblooding the peaceful protest with his oppressive tactics.
meanings.sent5: The dark history of the town was beblooding with tales of past conflicts.
